    • Method Detail

      • directDrive

        public abstract void directDrive(float xVal,
                                 float yVal,
                                 float rotVal)
        Directly drive the robot with power values.
        Parameters:
        xVal - Power in the left and right direction. Positive is to the right. Only supported by holonomic and mecanum drivetrains.
        yVal - Power in the forward and backward direction. Positive is forward.
        rotVal - Rotating value. Positive is clockwise.

      • directTankDrive

        public abstract void directTankDrive(float lVal,
                                     float rVal)
        Directly drive the robot using tank drive control.
        Parameters:
        lVal - Power of the left wheels. Positive is forward.
        rVal - Power to the right wheels. Positive is also forward.

      • setTargetX

        protected abstract void setTargetX(int ticks)

      • setTargetY

        protected abstract void setTargetY(int ticks)

      • isVerbose

        public boolean isVerbose()

      • setVerbose

        @Deprecated
public void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
        Deprecated. Use Config.setLoggingLevel(Config.LoggingLevel) instead.
        Sets the logging output level to 'verbose' or 'recommended'.
        Parameters:
        verbose - Whether everything should be logged.
        See Also:
        Config.setLoggingLevel(Config.LoggingLevel)

      • setPowerZero

        public void setPowerZero()
        Stops all motors.

      • resetEncoders

        public void resetEncoders()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Resets all encoders to zero and then switches them back to RUN_TO_POSITION
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - You are not using Movement with a LinearOpMode or have not provided an encoder pulses per inch.

      • directDrive

        public void directDrive(float yVal,
                        float rVal)
        Directly drive the robot with power values
        Parameters:
        yVal - Power in the forward and backward direction. Positive is forward.
        rVal - Power in the rotation direction. Positive is clockwise

      • yDrive

        public void yDrive(double dist,
                   float power)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Drive the robot in the y direction using encoders for a set distance at a set power.
        Parameters:
        dist - The distance in inches that the robot should drive. Positive is forward.
        power - The power that it should drive at.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - You are not using a LinearOpMode or have not provided an encoder pulses per inch.

      • xDrive

        public void xDrive(double dist,
                   float power)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Drive the robot in the x direction using encoders for a set distance at a set power.
        Parameters:
        dist - The distance in inches that the robot should drive. Positive is to the right.
        power - The power that it should drive at.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - You are not using a LinearOpMode or have not provided an encoder pulses per inch.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double deltaAngle,
                   double power)
        Rotate the robot by a provided angle.
        Parameters:
        deltaAngle - The difference in angle it should rotate in degrees. Positive is clockwise.
        power - The power it should rotate at.

      • driveUsingRange

        public void driveUsingRange(double threshold)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Drive until the range sensor is within certain distance of an object.
        Parameters:
        threshold - The distance in centimeters from the object when it should stop.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - No range sensor was provided.

      • setRunUsingEncoders

        public void setRunUsingEncoders(boolean runUsingEncoder)
